bunpro.meaning: Once …, If … for a short time, Temporarily (stop), For now or the time being
bunpro.meaning_warning: 一旦 can be rephrased to 一度 but not the other way around
bunpro.writeup: 一旦, an adverb meaning 'for a short time', or 'briefly', is a structure that is used in Japanese to indicate that 'once (A), (B)'. This particular meaning comes from the inclusion of hypothetical structures such as ば, と, or たら, and will usually appear with a negated verb in the (B) part of a sentence.一旦based sentences will indicate that returning to the previous state will be difficult, at least for a short time.Other common translations include 'for the time being', and 'for now'.一旦will primarily appear at the beginning of sentences, or directly before a ば, と, or たら modified verb.Fun-fact -一旦originally comes from the noun一旦meaning 'one morning', or 'one brief period'. The旦kanji itself signifies 'daybreak' or 'dawn'. In this way, it can be a useful memory tool to remember一旦as the 'dawning' of some period that will not end until it has run its own natural course.

examples.japanese: 一旦再起動をすれば、もとに戻るはずです。
examples.english: Once the system is rebooted, it should return to normal.

examples.japanese: 娘は一旦泣き出したら、しばらく泣き止まないので大変です。
examples.english: Once my daughter starts crying, she wont stop for a while, so it can get hard.

examples.japanese: 一旦集中力が切れてしまうと、再び集中するのに時間がかかる。
examples.english: Once I lose focus, it takes me a while to regain my focus.

examples.japanese: 一旦一戸建てに住めばアパートに戻れない。
examples.english: Once you live in a stand-alone house, you won't be able to go back to an apartment.

examples.japanese: 一旦いつのまにか健康を失うなら健康の価値を理解するでしょう。
examples.english: Once you lose your health (without you noticing), you will understand its value.

examples.japanese: 一旦これをしたら残りをAさんに任せてください。
examples.english: Once you do this, please leave the rest to A-san.

examples.japanese: 「一旦赤いカプセルを飲むとワンダーランドに帰れないだろう。そしてきみにウサギの穴の奥を見せよう。」
examples.english: 'Once you take the red pill, you won't be able to return to Wonderland. And I will show you just how deep the rabbit hole goes.'

examples.japanese: 一旦何かを学ぶのを止めると再開しにくくなる。
examples.english: Once you stop learning something, starting again becomes hard.

dojg.description: An adverb meaning “once” or “for a short time”.
dojg.meaning: Once; for a time; temporarily; for the moment; for the present; now

examples.japanese: (ksa).このは小説一旦読み始めたらやめられない。
examples.english: Once you begin reading this novel, you won't be able to put it  down (literally: stop reading it).

examples.japanese: (ksb).邦彦は一旦やめたタバコをまた吸い出した。
examples.english: Kunihiko resumed smoking, which he had quit for a time.

examples.japanese: (ksc).開演までまだだいぶ時間があるので、一旦ホテルに帰ってから出直そう。
examples.english: There's still a lot of time before the performance begins, so  let's go back to the hotel (now) and come again later.

examples.japanese: (a).この大学は、一旦入学してしまえば、そんなに勉強しなくても必ず卒業できる。
examples.english: Once you've entered this university, you will definitely be  able to graduate, even if you don't study very hard.

examples.japanese: (b).この電子掲示板は一旦書き込むと消せないので、自分のメッセージを書く時に注意しないといけない。
examples.english: Once you write a message on this electronic bulletin board, you  cannot delete it, so you have to be careful (when you write a message).

examples.japanese: (c).石田は、一旦約束した以上は必ず守る男だ。
examples.english: Ishida is someone who keeps his promise (once he has made one),  no matter what.

examples.japanese: (d).一旦こじれた我々の関係は、容易には元に戻らなかった。
examples.english: Our relationship, once it had become complicated, did not  recover easily.

examples.japanese: (e).予算が厳しくなったので、無料健康相談サービスを一旦中止します。
examples.english: Because the budget has become tight, we are going to  discontinue our free health consultation service temporarily.

examples.japanese: (f).新型ウイルスの被害は一旦終息したように見えた。
examples.english: It appeared that damage from the new virus had subsided  temporarily.

examples.japanese: (g).ひょっとすると違う原因かもしれないので、今飲んでいる薬を一旦やめてしばらく様子を見てみましょう。
examples.english: There might be a different cause, so stop taking the current  drug for the moment and see what happens.

examples.japanese: (h).今使っているプログラムを一旦終了して、再起動してみて下さい。
examples.english: Please quite the current program (literally: the program you  are using now) temporarily and reboot.

examples.japanese: (i).一旦日本へ帰って、親と相談してからアメリカで就職するかどうかを決めたい。
examples.english: I'd like to go back to Japan for a time and, (when I'm there)  after talking to my parents, decide whether or not I'll look for a job in the  U.S.
